comment: Every release seems to break core functionality. This time, after pressing any character, the chat or agent editor loses focus, forcing you to click again with the mouse before typing the next character. If this plugin received even 5% of the time and attention given to the VSCode plugin, it would be legendary in the JetBrains ecosystem. It feels like the GitHub team intentionally frustrates developers to push them from JetBrains to VSCode. It’s disappointing that the JetBrains team has also failed to keep up with AI integration in their plugin.

Absolute piece of crap. When you enter the Edit mode, most of the time it doesn't let you pick a model, so you have to switch to another mode and go back to Edit again; it fails a lot with a dumb error message about not being able to parse the content, etc. Tabnine is a godsend in comparison. And cheaper.

Never really worked properly. You can't even select snippets from the output anymore. This extension is really really terrible. I find myself os often copy pasting and using the browser AI instead of copilot because it just doesn't work
Works well when its working...but lots of crashes and seems to need reinstall after every update.
Very buggy

The whole thing just crashes the Westorm IDE as soon as it tries to write a file, I'm on the latest windows 11 and the latest update of the IDE, so I don't know what went wrong this plugin, the CPU hangs at 100%, and I have to forcefully close the IDE. NOTHING works.

Crashes whenever I switch to a new project and the autocompletion is very annoying, giving random code not even related to my project. Chat can work sometimes on a good level, but it's too biased in it's own quality.
Agent mode is useless, it just keeps creating .patch files and asks for permission to run the command.
Love the new MCP integration. And fast response from engineer teams.

It never been good, and it's getting worse. Super slow, super stupid, sometimes it creates meaningless .patch files instead editing files. Sometimes wants to run some script to edit the file, and breaks the file. IDE is getting super slow when the plugin is opened.
So unbelievably buggy & short-sighted, it makes it useless. Documentation atrocious too.
Read and WRITE access is required to all of my private repos just to use the plugin? This is nothing short of insanity.

With each update the integration gets worse. I had to resort to installing an older version, so it would stop crashing when switching projects. There are also other very annoying bugs, for example: after rejecting some changes the plugin keeps reapplying them on random occasions.

GitHub Copilot is awesome. But with all the choices made in the last few releases... it seems like some kids decided to take over the project and things are going south. Last stupid decision: remove the keyboard shortcut that triggers manual autocomplete. Guys, is this your way of making people hate GitHub Copilot's Jetbrains integration so they switch to Code?

I agree with those who claim it's getting worse and worse. Automatic completions must be disabled all the time because, over time, they become faster but less intelligent. If someone claims it works for them, it might do — but only if they follow well-known coding patterns or vibecoding. The most annoying thing is reverting deleted code. Removing the ability to manually complete code makes it unusable. It breaks other IDE functionality too. Alt+Enter stopped working, so there's no context menu on demand. This is FUBAR.

The rating of this plugin is already way below 3 stars and approaching 2. So what they do – they remove the feature that allowed invoking code suggestions manually, on demand. And only keep "automatic code suggestions" only, which are not usable at all. Way to go guys!

Sooo... here's Microsoft. A software compoany. But it apparantly can't develop software anymore that nearly fails on every click, every interaction with the ui, most mcp calls. It has an absolute mess of a UI with horrific usability. There are so many usability issues I don't know where to start, but let me try anyway:

  1. if you want to add an attachment to a chat, you either use the #file prefix or use the mouse to click the attachment symbol, so far so good. Then the search popup opens and you happily type away until you notice that the text input isn't focused and there's no hotkey for it. Why?! WHY?! You have to use the mouse to focus it.
  2. Sometimes the chat input doesn't accept the space bar (?!)
  3. nowadays half of the tool calls fail, and there's no way to check what's going on, you can't see any output
  4. you cannot modify the instructions anymore using the agent mode, because there's a new section in the setting preventing the agent from accessing it (good security measure, thumbs up). BUT, you CANNOT disable it by exclusion list. You cannot disable that.... why offer it then?
  5. the versionening between chat interactions is not working at all. I don't know what they implemented there, but it is certainly not rolling back the changes probably. If you use this, you're guaranteed to have a messed up files afterwards. Only use GIT or similar for versioning, never rely on the copilot's feature.

... there's definitely more where this came from. All in all, it is just a complete insult to offer this plugin (paid or not) to anyone. It doesn't work even for the most basic stuff. I'd really want it to, but come on.

Read the style guide for the platform you are developing for. Don't just vibecode and hotglue.

This plugin is genuine trash. Even vibe-coding with zerok knowledge can't be THAT bad. Literally no feature works without bugs. It logs out every few hours and it is impossible to login without reinstalling. The chat never keeps context regardless of what mode you use. The suggestions selection and editing is broken.

I've had fairly good success with Copilot itself but this plugin leaves much to be desired. I've had one person on my team and have heard of devs on other teams jump ship from Jetbrains to VS Code because the Copilot integration is superior to that of the Jetbrains plugin and the company is rolling out licenses for GitHub Copilot to all devs. I am going to learn how to use VS Code for the same reason.

This plugin will simply stop working and you have to restart the IDE. You might be near completion of vibe coding when "Oops, the token limit exceeded" appears. I believe that Copilot prompt files are not as well supported as in VS Code. Other glitches as well.

It regularly messes up lots of code, kills own changes, lots of bugs, and with every update it gets even worse.

It's truly shameful what's being delivered here. Probably the whole plugin is vibe coded....

Don't be fooled by the bad reviews of amateurs!

I have no idea what kind of kids use this tool in their code games...

  • After two years of working with various AI agents with code completion, I am confidently returning to GitHUb Copilot... There's nothing better yet. There is nothing faster, more stable, more accurate and more efficient.

If you, like me, are a professional developer - then this tool will do everything that is required of it better than any other similar one.
This plugin makes my IDE lag like a PowerPoint — every time I type a character, it freezes for a moment. Do you guys not use your own plugin?

I genuinely can’t understand — do you have no testing at all? Why does every update completely break the functionality? EVERY UPDATE. I just updated — and now I can’t use the plugin again — the login doesn’t work.
just updated and now chat windows is just blank. What a lame
It gets worse with every new update.
Plugin is amazing and very great. Could it display github account name?

There is this VERY annoying thing with this plugin, when you click on a new chat session, it takes way too long to show up a new chat. I am talking it can take like a minute, it is completely absurd. You will probably click many times in frustration because you cant understand how something so simple can work so awfully wrong. Then eventually a new chat would come up, you start typing your new request, and since you clicked on the new button more than one time, the new chat sessions will popup, making you lose everything you typed. So you learn the hard way to click ONCE, and WAIT. This has been going on since forever, and I cant understand how it is still happening, after hundres of updates.

Lo vengo usando hace unos meses, no va tan bien como el del VS Code, pero funcionaba. En algún momento decidieron unificar el historial de chats, donde antes veía las conversaciones sobre el proyecto que tengo abierto, ahora veo un único chat y no sé de qué proyecto hablaba. Caracteristica no personalizable. Es como si hubieran tirado el plugin a la basura.

It was helpful, but it suddenly needs read and write access to everything on my GitHub account. I just want the code suggestions, I don't want an AI that can potentially just delete everything in my repos. It can't be used without those permissions.
It's full of bugs
If this plugin in agent mode make multiple changes in the same file, only the last change will be applied. Did you seriously not notice this during testing? When will this be fixed?

The plugin is good, although quite expensive. But the most disappointing part is that there’s no Ukrainian language option in the settings, even though as a language model it could easily respond in Ukrainian. Meanwhile, Russian is available — please, I strongly ask you to add Ukrainian as well.
It started out a bit rough, but it's getting better and better. Agent mode is working pretty well and having the ability to try out different models is very welcomed. Nice productivity boost.

Avast Antivirus detects a virus and blocks version 1.5.58-243 of Github Copilot. I cannot update it to the latest version. However, when I try to install version 1.5.57-243 (or previous versions), it installs successfully and the antivirus doesn't detect any viruses. Please fix this problem — I cannot install or update to the latest version because Avast Antivirus blocks it.

Copilot with Claude 4.5 is a great experience. I'm not using it in Agent mode or "vibe coding" entire apps, but it's been amazing at:

  • Generating wrapper classes
  • Configuring dependencies
  • Solid boilerplate for new APIs
  • Troubleshooting compilation and serialization errors
  • Generating DTOs, BOs, REST controllers
  • Writing quick adapters and conversion methods
  • Applying optimized annotations and removing unnecessary code
  • Offers concise explanations and alternative ideas - great "pair programming partner" and brainstorming buddy
  • Writes excellent mock and functional tests with proper stubbing and coverage of all methods, logic paths, and edge cases
  • Understands large codebases and (with guidance sometimes) finds the relevant context in the project to generate code

It's not perfect but when used properly is very helpful.

Completely unusable. In agent mode it doesn't edit files. It just generates code in chat. When asked about available tools, it says than no editing tools are available (despite being checked in the tool selection). Next edit suggestions appear very rarely. If they do, they're nonsense. And sometimes the next edit suggestion tooltip won't close, and stays on top of the window - the only way to get rid of it is to restart IDE.
Cannot edit files in agent mode most of the time. Randomly hangs forever when trying to modify a file.
Impressive how horrible this plugin can be for a paid product
Oops, maximum tool attempts reached. You can type 'continue' to proceed or rephrase your request. But there is no "Continue" button in the extension.
In Agent and Edit mode, files sometimes cannot be edited
Not worth it by any metric
Why is the option to manually trigger the completions gone ?
A month has passed... Still not working.
Edits (especially in Agent Mode) often do not work, the files stay as they are. When doing completions, the Plugin does appearently not read the imports, includes non-existing enum values and so on.

Is there a purer plugin? When I tried my best to describe my idea in detail, I clicked the send button full of joy, and then the IDE directly suggested that the plugin had an error, and then the text I sent was directly empty. It was ridiculous. I didn't get the results I wanted. I had to rethink what my idea was. Before I restart all of this I have to make a comment here for a bit of fun

Agent mode is a game changer for this extension. It was previously clumsy and got in the way. But since agent mode became available it's changed the way I develop.

My only complaint is the JetBrains version of Copilot lags behind the VSCode extension, so you have to check feature availability when reading documentation and blog posts.

I suspect users complaining about instability are stuck on older versions. It's shown a huge improvement lately.
can be a great help but it keeps reopening old files for no reason. the token limit is too low you can only do a single agent request because the next will always be cut off

The idea of it is great, but it makes Intellij IDEA completely unusable.

  • Undo with Ctrl-Z does not work at all or changes random things in the file
  • Syntax check not working
  • IDE gets extremely laggy

Uninstalled and stopped paying for Copilot, because this plugin constantly broke the whole IDE, where only deleting .idea folder and reimporting whole project restored it. It happened up to several times a day. Otherwise it would be acceptable.
All of a sudden, Copilot refuses to implement any of its suggested changes. I've tried over and over, and it says it's going to implement the change, and then it doesn't. What's up with this?
